intro: Pancheria vieillardii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, spurred flowers. The plant typically features velvety, dark green leaves and produces clusters of tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. Pancheria vieillardii thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil.
